SEARCH
Package com.sweatshop.path.utils

Class Cell

java.lang.Object
com.sweatshop.path.utils.Cell
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Cell extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a single cell in the game grid. Each cell has a position (x,y), an optional number, and can be part of the current path.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor

    Cell()
    Default constructor that creates a cell at position (0,0) with no number.

  • Constructor Details

    • Cell

      public Cell()
      Default constructor that creates a cell at position (0,0) with no number.

    • Cell

      public Cell(int x, int y, int number)
      constructs a cell with the given coordinates and number
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the cell in the grid
      y - the y-coordinate of the cell in the grid
      number - the number inside the cell

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer shapeRenderer, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch, float cellSize, float padding, float x, float y)
      Draws the cell starting on the provided coordinates
      Parameters:
      shapeRenderer - shapeRenderer to draw shapes on
      batch - batch to draw text on
      cellSize - size of the cell in pixels
      padding - half the padding between the cells
      x - starting x-coordinate of the grid
      y - starting y-coordinate of the grid

    • setPartOfPath

      public void setPartOfPath(boolean partOfPath)
      Sets whether this cell is part of the current path.
      Parameters:
      partOfPath - true if the cell should be part of the path, false otherwise

    • isPartOfPath

      public boolean isPartOfPath()
      Checks if this cell is part of the current path.
      Returns:
      true if the cell is part of the path, false otherwise

    • getNumber

      public int getNumber()
      Gets the number displayed in this cell.
      Returns:
      the cell's number, or 0 if no number is set

    • setNumber

      public void setNumber(int number)
      Sets the number to be displayed in this cell.
      Parameters:
      number - the number to display, or 0 to clear the number

      Gets the x-coordinate of this cell in the grid.
